sentence.Network_en: For her, books were as necessary to life as bread.
sentence.Network_cn: 对她来说，书就像面包一样，是生活必需品。

sentence.Network_en: Try to eat at least four slices of bread a day.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天尽量至少吃4片面包。

sentence.Network_en: The government increased prices on several basic commodities like bread and meat.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府提高了面包、肉类等几种基本商品的价格。

phrase.cizu_name: be the best (或 greatest) thing since sliced bread

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to emphasize one's enthusiasm about a new idea, person, or thing
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)最好的东西（用于强调对新思想，人物或事物的热忱）

jx.jx_en_mean: used to refer to a diet of entertainment or political policies on which the masses are fed to keep them happy and docile
jx.jx_cn_mean: 面包和马戏观赏（指为安抚目的给予群众的好处或实施的政策）；食物和娱乐

jx.jx_en_mean: a frugal diet that is eaten in poverty, chosen in abstinence, or given as a punishment
jx.jx_cn_mean: （因贫困、节食或惩罚而吃的）面包和白开水，粗茶淡饭

jx.jx_en_mean: the consecrated elements used in the celebration of the Eucharist; the sacrament of the Eucharist
something regarded as a source of spiritual nourishment

phrase.cizu_name: one cannot live by bread alone

jx.jx_en_mean: people have spiritual as well as physical needs
jx.jx_cn_mean: 人无法仅靠面包生活，精神需要和肉体需要同等重要

phrase.cizu_name: cast one's bread upon the waters

jx.jx_en_mean: do good without expecting gratitude or reward
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不期望报答地做好事，真心行善不求回报

jx.jx_en_mean: the money or food that one needs in order to live

lj.lj_ly: she earned her daily bread by working long hours.

phrase.cizu_name: know which side one's bread is buttered (on)

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)明白自己的利益之所在；善于为自己打算

phrase.cizu_name: take the bread out of (或 from) people's mouths

jx.jx_en_mean: deprive people of their livings by competition or unfair working practices
jx.jx_cn_mean: 抢某人的饭碗，夺某人的生计

phrase.cizu_name: want one's bread buttered on both sides

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)want more than is practicable or than is reasonable to expect
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)抱有不切实际的希望；提出不合情理的要求

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brēad, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch brood and German Brot

entry.def: Bread is a very common food made from flour, water, and yeast.

entry.tran: （通过工作等挣得的）钱财，金钱
entry.def: If you earn your bread doing a particular job or activity, you earn your money doing it.

example.ex: There's not a living soul in Colorado who doesn't depend for his bread on silver.
example.tran: 科罗拉多的每一个人都是靠着开采银矿养家糊口。

entry.def: If food such as fish or meat is breaded, it is covered in tiny pieces of dry bread called breadcrumbs. It can then be fried or grilled.

example.ex: It is important that food be breaded just minutes before frying.
example.tran: 把食物抹上面包屑后过几分钟就炸，这一点很重要。

means.word_mean: 1. food made from dough of flour or meal and usually raised with yeast or baking powder and then baked

sentences.sentence: "bread the pork chops before frying them"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Soak the slice of bread in the same vinegar.

auth_sentence.res_content: Remove the bread and rub with the garlic clove.

auth_sentence.content: Once the bread has drained, prepare the tomatoes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Once the bread has drained, prepare the tomatoes.

sentences.en: I had three pieces of bread for breakfast this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天早餐我吃了三片面包。

sentences.en: He took barely enough money to keep the children in bread.
sentences.cn: 他赚很少的钱仅够孩子们勉强糊口。

sentences.en: Painting is his bread and butter.

jushi.english: He spent all his uncle's bread on wine and beer.
jushi.chinese: 他把叔叔的钱全都花在葡萄酒和啤酒上。

jushi.english: The bread was burnt black and hard.
